paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the V30M variant in the TTR gene, focusing on its clinical significance, penetrance data, and biomarker potential in ATTRv amyloidosis.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: All but 4 A-ATTRv patients had neurological involvement, most of them with late disease onset (20 patients, 80.0%).
All but 4 A-ATTRv patients had neurological involvement, most of them with late disease onset (20 patients, 80.0%).

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant is associated with elevated NfL levels, indicating axonal damage.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early diagnosis and monitoring of disease progression in A-ATTRv.
key_quotes: V30M (p.V50M) is the most common TTR variant and is associated with ATTR amyloidosis-related polyneuropathy.
Median NfL levels were 116 pg/mL in A-ATTRv patients, significantly higher than in asymptomatic carriers.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the V30M variant in TTR.
